column5: Flatfish used to be a hot lure on lake erie when my dad was younger for walleyes and blue pike. Needless to say when we started going to Canada it was his lure of choice. LOL I never caught a walleye on one, pike seemed to love them and the occasional bass ate them. A lot of spin offs, and there where similar store brands sold here in the states.  They do have a good action to them, Beno also made a similar lure, (Mill Run products out of Cleveland Ohio).

Nope, dave524 got it correct. The lure you are looking for is the Luhr Jensen Fishback. Case closed. Here are 4 of them for sale on ebay.  Pretty cheap too. http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=280484112576

hey slashhopper track down where Archie is selling from,he use to be on Hamilton Road but I think he is back selling out of his garage over on Emerson Ave.(Thompson Rd. and Adelaide area) He always had lots of dated lures all still brand new in his store on Ham road.

Send me your address, and I'll send you one. It's been in one of my tackle boxes for 25 years, and hasn't seen the light of day, for at least half that. Maybe you can catch something on it, as I'm pretty sure I never did.
U got mail
Dang... archie is 5 minutes away... i never thought of him and I will be dropping by for minnows from him soon too  Thanks
"Broken Bobber" has a red and white one too and doesn;t know the name of it either.  Help us out now please.  Thanks
looks like a canadian wiggler or similar.... http://canadianwiggler.com/ecom.asp?pg=canadianwiggler
Lazy Ike  (I think)
Or a Flat Fish....
hmmm where did my first post go? canadian wiggler?
another to ponder, the kwik fish.
I don't think it's any of those... CW had a concave head and no flare. Flat fish didn't have flared heads and neither did Ike's as I recall.
kwikfish or flatfish have the best action from that family of baits.  (at least for pike).
kwik fish
canadian wiggler. flatfish has a much flatter head...  haven't heard of a lazy ike.  must be an old timer thing.
hmmmmm... no consensus yet.... where are all the OLD guys ?
Definitely none of the above.....might be a custom bait. I'll search.
Thanks for speaking up first Dad!

There are more ol boys than u two guys... maybe they went to bed already!  It doesn't look like a custom bait though... it looks old ... maybe Broken Bobber can take a pic of his and post it on this thread too.
Mine is up at the cottage, won't be there until next month.
How old do u think it is ?  I think mine has to be at least 10 years or more

I have a couple of these lures in yellow.  I think they must date back to the seventies. If I remember correctly, they were made by Luhr Jensen.  I picked they up at a dumpy tackle shop down on Kingston Rd in east end Toronto called Rebbies a few years ago.  That place carries tonnes of out dated lures.
husky jerk

Think it is an old Luhr Jensen " Fishback ". believe I have one somewhere  edit: did the google thing, came up with this , looks like them  http://s975.photobucket.com/albums/ae237/Old_Relics/Lure%20Displays/?action=view&current=IM007410.jpg&currenttag=Fishback%20display%20Luhr%20Jensen
Ding, Ding, Ding....we have a winner! That's the one, Dave.

The one I have is the middle one on the right hand side, the glo phlorescent green, it has very stout galvanized hooks, probably got it for pier casting staging Kings at night. Flatfish type lures were at one time very popular for salmon in the lake, Heddon had one called a " Tadpolly " I did well with on spring Kings, Luhr Jensen had the "Fireplug "  a spring fishing staple in the late 70's,  " Kwikfish " was popular as it handled speed better then the Helin  " Flatfish " and my personal favourite was the "Canadian Wiggler " in the jointed model great on salmon and deadly on Erie eyes too, for eyes we would add a bit of nightcrawler to the front treble. There were probably others too.
Dang, you beat me to it Dave.
Still have a couple of Fireplugs somewhere. Lots of Tadpolly's, they're deadly (and still sold).  Good call on the Fishback!
The head of the lure looks a LOT wider on the one I have. But I think it's close.
YEP! That's it... The one I have is the bottom right. My old faithfull....ALWAYS catch Pike with it.  Thanks for finding that photo.
